faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to your questions about period pain management

q1.question: How does PeriodHub help me manage period pain?
q1.answer: PeriodHub provides smart tracking, professional assessment, and evidence-based medical guides to help you scientifically manage period pain symptoms.

q2.question: Is my data secure?
q2.answer: We use the highest level of data encryption and privacy protection measures to ensure your personal information is secure.

q3.question: Are the medical guides on the platform reliable?
q3.answer: All medical guides are based on evidence-based medicine and reviewed by professional medical teams to ensure scientific accuracy.

q4.question: How can I get personalized recommendations?
q4.answer: Through symptom assessment and pain tracking, our AI system will provide you with personalized health recommendations.

q5.question: Is the platform free?
q5.answer: Basic features are completely free, with premium features available as paid options to ensure service sustainability.

q6.question: When should I see a doctor?
q6.answer: If period pain seriously affects your life or you experience abnormal symptoms, we recommend consulting a professional doctor promptly.

q7.question: How do I start using the platform?
q7.answer: After registering an account, complete the basic assessment to start using all features.

hero.title: üåø Natural Therapies for Period Pain
hero.subtitle: Science-backed natural methods, gentle and effective, with no side effects

scientificFoundation.title: üî¨ Scientific Foundation
scientificFoundation.description: Natural therapies combine modern medical research with traditional wisdom, providing safe and effective options for menstrual pain management. Multiple clinical studies confirm their efficacy.

noSideEffects.title: No Side Effects
noSideEffects.description: Gentle and natural, without drug dependency or adverse reactions

holisticApproach.title: Holistic Approach
holisticApproach.description: Fundamentally improves constitution and overall health

costEffective.title: Cost-Effective
costEffective.description: Most methods are affordable and sustainable long-term

heatTherapy.title: Heat Therapy
heatTherapy.subtitle: The simplest and most effective physical therapy
heatTherapy.description: Heat therapy promotes blood circulation and relaxes uterine smooth muscle through thermal effects, making it one of the most direct and effective methods for relieving menstrual pain.

parameters.title: Scientific Parameters
parameters.timingValue: Start 1-2 days before period for prevention
parameters.mechanismValue: Heat stimulates skin temperature receptors, blocking pain signals through 'gate control theory'

gateControl.title: Gate Control Theory
gateControl.description: Thermal stimulation activates large fiber nerves, inhibiting pain signals from small fibers

vasodilation.title: Vasodilation Effect
vasodilation.description: Heat promotes local vasodilation, improving uterine blood supply and relieving ischemic pain

guidelines.0: Avoid direct skin contact, use a towel barrier
guidelines.1: Do not use while sleeping to prevent low-temperature burns
guidelines.2: Stop if skin is broken or infected

herbalTherapy.title: Herbal Therapy
herbalTherapy.subtitle: Traditional wisdom meets modern validation
herbalTherapy.description: Herbal medicine has a long history in treating menstrual pain. Modern research confirms that active compounds have anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and hormone-regulating effects.

ginger.title: Ginger (Zingiber officinale)
ginger.mechanismValue: Inhibits prostaglandin synthesis, reduces uterine contractions
ginger.clinicalEvidenceValue: Studies show efficacy comparable to ibuprofen (Ozgoli et al., 2009)

angelica.title: Angelica (Angelica sinensis)
angelica.mechanismValue: Regulates estrogen levels, improves uterine blood circulation
angelica.classicFormulaValue: Si Wu Tang, Dang Gui Shao Yao San

gingerTea.title: Ginger Tea
gingerTea.description: Slice 10g fresh ginger, steep in boiling water for 10 minutes, start 3 days before period, 2-3 times daily

angelicaDecoction.title: Angelica Decoction
angelicaDecoction.description: 10g angelica, add 300ml water, simmer for 20 minutes, take during menstruation

guidelines.2: Consult TCM practitioner for first use

dietaryAdjustment.title: Dietary Adjustments
dietaryAdjustment.subtitle: Nutritional support from within
dietaryAdjustment.description: A balanced diet can regulate hormone levels, reduce inflammation, and provide adequate nutritional support.

magnesium.title: Magnesium
magnesium.sourcesValue: Dark leafy greens, nuts, whole grains

avoid.title: Foods to Avoid
list: Processed foods high in trans fats

yogaExercise.title: Yoga & Exercise
yogaExercise.subtitle: Gentle movement, stress release
yogaExercise.description: Moderate yoga practice can improve blood circulation, relax muscles, and reduce pain.

science.title: Scientific Basis
science.bloodCirculationValue: Improves pelvic blood flow and reduces muscle tension
science.muscleRelaxationValue: Gentle stretching releases uterine muscle spasms

precautions.1: Listen to your body, don't overstretch
precautions.2: Avoid inverted poses during heavy flow
precautions.3: Stop if you feel dizzy or nauseous
precautions.title: Precautions

aromatherapy.title: Aromatherapy
aromatherapy.subtitle: The healing power of essential oils
aromatherapy.description: Certain essential oils have analgesic, relaxing, and mood-regulating effects, used through massage or diffusion.

romanChamomile.title: Roman Chamomile Essential Oil
romanChamomile.mechanismValue: Absorbed through olfactory and skin pathways, directly affecting the nervous system

massageOil.title: Massage Oil
massageOil.instructionsValue: Gently massage lower abdomen, avoid mucous membranes

science.title: Scientific Mechanism
science.mechanismValue: Essential oils enter through olfactory and skin pathways, directly affecting the nervous system and endocrine system
science.durationValue: 15-30 minutes, can be used multiple times daily
science.bioavailabilityValue: Absorbed through skin and respiratory system, bypassing liver metabolism

guidelines.0: Essential oils must be diluted before use, do not apply directly

acupuncture.title: Acupuncture & Massage
acupuncture.subtitle: Traditional Chinese medicine therapy
acupuncture.description: Acupuncture relieves pain by stimulating specific points and regulating qi and blood.

sanyinjiao.title: Sanyinjiao (SP6)
sanyinjiao.locationValue: 3 inches above medial malleolus, behind tibia
sanyinjiao.description: Sanyinjiao is a key gynecological point with significant effects on regulating menstruation and relieving dysmenorrhea

guanyuan.title: Guanyuan (CV4)
guanyuan.effectsValue: Tonifies kidney qi, warms lower abdomen
guanyuan.description: Guanyuan is a key point for tonifying vital energy and has excellent effects on dysmenorrhea

shenque.title: Shenque (CV8)
shenque.description: Shenque is located at the navel center and is an important point for regulating organ functions

mechanisms.title: Mechanisms of Action

gateControl.title: Gate Control Theory
gateControl.description: Stimulates nerve fibers to block pain signals

endorphin.title: Endorphin Release
endorphin.description: Promotes release of natural pain-relieving chemicals

circulation.title: Improved Circulation
circulation.description: Enhances blood flow to pelvic organs

mechanisms.neuralRegulationValue: Stimulates nerve endings to regulate pain transmission
mechanisms.endocrineRegulationValue: Balances hormone levels and reduces inflammatory responses
mechanisms.evidenceBasedValue: Multiple studies confirm acupuncture's effectiveness for dysmenorrhea

selfMassage.title: Self-Massage

techniques.1: Gentle circular massage on lower abdomen
techniques.2: Apply pressure to acupoints for 30-60 seconds
techniques.title: Massage Techniques

precautions.1: Use gentle pressure, avoid excessive force
precautions.title: Precautions

sanyinjiao.title: Sanyinjiao Massage
sanyinjiao.instructions: Press with thumb, 1-2 minutes per session, moderate pressure

guanyuan.title: Guanyuan Massage
guanyuan.instructions: Gently massage clockwise, 3-5 minutes per session

selfMassage.noteValue: Moderate pressure, avoid excessive force; stop immediately if discomfort occurs

psychological.title: Psychological Regulation
psychological.subtitle: Mind-body balance
psychological.description: Stress and anxiety can worsen pain; psychological regulation techniques can help relieve it.

mindfulness.title: Mindfulness Meditation
mindfulness.methodValue: Focus on present moment, observe sensations without judgment
mindfulness.effectValue: Reduces pain perception, improves emotional regulation

muscleRelaxation.title: Progressive Muscle Relaxation
muscleRelaxation.step1: Tense each muscle group for 5 seconds, then release
muscleRelaxation.step2: Progress from feet upward to head
muscleRelaxation.step3: Combine with deep breathing, feel tension and relaxation
muscleRelaxation.step1Value: Tense each muscle group for 5 seconds
muscleRelaxation.step2Value: Release tension and feel relaxation for 10 seconds
muscleRelaxation.step3Value: Progress through all major muscle groups
muscleRelaxation.effectValue: Reduces overall muscle tension and stress

comprehensive.title: Comprehensive Approach
comprehensive.subtitle: Combining multiple methods
comprehensive.description: Depending on pain severity, combining multiple natural therapies can achieve better results.

synergistic.title: Synergistic Effects
synergistic.description: Combining multiple therapies creates synergistic effects that are greater than the sum of individual treatments

enhancing.title: Enhancing Effects
enhancing.combination1: Heat therapy + Yoga: Dual relaxation effects
enhancing.combination2: Herbal tea + Massage: Internal and external treatment

personalized.coldConstitution: Cold constitution: Warm tonification with heat therapy
personalized.hotConstitution: Hot constitution: Heat clearing with cold compress
personalized.qiDeficiency: Qi deficiency: Qi tonification with breathing exercises

heatTherapy.title: Heat Therapy
heatTherapy.sourceValue: Cochrane Review (2020): 73% pain reduction in 15 minutes
heatTherapy.efficacyValue: Significantly reduces pain intensity and duration

tens.sourceValue: BMJ Study (2019): 65% pain reduction with TENS

medicalDisclaimer.title: Medical Disclaimer
medicalDisclaimer.content: The information provided on this page is for educational and reference purposes only and does not constitute medical advice. If you have severe or persistent menstrual pain symptoms, please consult a healthcare professional.

warnings.1: Seek immediate medical attention for severe pain
warnings.2: Consult healthcare provider before starting new therapies
warnings.3: Discontinue use if adverse reactions occur
warnings.4: Not a substitute for professional medical treatment
warnings.title: Important Warnings

faq.effectiveTherapies: Which natural therapies are most effective?
faq.effectiveTherapiesAnswer: Heat therapy, ginger tea, and moderate exercise are the most scientifically supported natural therapies.
faq.timeToEffect: How long does it take for natural therapies to work?
faq.timeToEffectAnswer: Heat therapy usually works within 15-20 minutes, while herbal therapies need 2-3 menstrual cycles of consistent use to see significant improvement.
faq.safetyAnswer: Most natural therapies are safe when used correctly, but consult a healthcare provider for severe pain.
faq.combination: Can I combine multiple natural therapies?
faq.combinationAnswer: Yes, combining therapies often produces better results than using them individually.
faq.whenToSeekHelp: When should I seek medical help?
faq.whenToSeekHelpAnswer: Seek immediate medical attention if pain is severe, sudden, or accompanied by other symptoms.
faq.pregnancy: Can I use natural therapies during pregnancy?
faq.pregnancyAnswer: Some therapies are safe during pregnancy, but always consult your healthcare provider first.
faq.medication: Can I use natural therapies with medication?
faq.medicationAnswer: Most natural therapies can be used alongside medication, but discuss with your healthcare provider.

teenHealth.description: Adolescence brings many worries, and "those days" each month can be especially concerning. Pain, mood swings, body changes... Don't worry, you're not fighting alone. We've prepared campus emergency guides, developmental pain management, emotional support, and communication skills to help you confidently navigate every period.

stressLevels.lowDesc: Low stress level, maintaining good condition
stressLevels.moderateDesc: Moderate stress, requires attention and regulation
stressLevels.highDesc: High stress, recommend taking relief measures

resources.title: Resource Recommendations
resources.subtitle: More resources to help you manage stress

common.medicalDisclaimer: This website content is for informational and educational purposes only and is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Please consult a healthcare professional for any health concerns.

neuroendocrine.title: Neuroendocrine Cascade
neuroendocrine.subtitle: Understanding how stress affects menstruation through complex physiological mechanisms

acute.title: Acute Stress Response
acute.description: Short-term stress activates HPA axis, releases cortisol, usually recovers quickly

chronic.title: Chronic Stress Impact
chronic.description: Long-term stress causes persistent cortisol elevation, may severely affect menstrual cycle

neuroendocrine.keyInsightDescription: Understanding these mechanisms helps better manage stress impact on menstruation

evolutionary.title: Evolutionary Biology Perspective
evolutionary.subtitle: Why does stress affect menstruation? The ancient wisdom of the body
evolutionary.mainDescription: Stress effects on menstruation are actually protective mechanisms
evolutionary.storyContent: When our ancestors faced life threats, the body would automatically judge that it's not a good time for reproduction and pause ovulation and menstruation.
evolutionary.modernContent: Work stress, relationship issues and other psychological pressures are misinterpreted by the body as survival threats, continuously activating ancient systems.
evolutionary.realization1: Your body's response is not a malfunction
evolutionary.realization2: It's executing an ancient protection program
evolutionary.realization3: Understanding this can reduce self-blame and anxiety
evolutionary.practicalDescription: When you feel stress affecting your menstruation, try telling yourself:
evolutionary.selfTalk: My body is protecting me, this is a normal physiological response. Now I need to tell it: the crisis is over, you can relax.

action1.title: Cognitive Reframing
action1.description: View stress response as protection rather than problem

action2.title: Relaxation Training
action2.description: Tell your body the crisis is over through relaxation techniques

detail1.title: Survival Advantage
detail1.content: This mechanism helped our ancestors survive in crises

detail2.title: Modern Adaptation
detail2.content: Need to learn to distinguish real threats from psychological stress

detail3.title: Self-Compassion
detail3.content: Maintain understanding and compassion for body's responses

comparison.title: Acute vs Chronic Stress
comparison.subtitle: Understanding characteristics and impacts of different stress types
comparison.keyTakeawayContent: Acute stress is usually manageable, chronic stress requires systematic intervention.

action1.title: Acute Stress Management
action1.description: Use immediate relief techniques like deep breathing and short breaks

action2.title: Chronic Stress Intervention
action2.description: Requires long-term strategies and possibly professional help

assessment.title: Stress Assessment
assessment.subtitle: Understand your stress condition through scientific assessment
assessment.instructionsDetail: Please answer the following questions honestly based on your actual situation. This will help us provide you with personalized stress management recommendations.

q1.question: Have you frequently felt anxious or tense recently?

q3.question: Do you often feel tired or lack energy?

q4.question: Do you easily feel irritable or angry?

q5.question: Do you often worry about period-related issues?

personalized.title: Personalized Recommendations
personalized.description: Provide customized stress management strategies based on your answers

tracking.title: Progress Tracking
tracking.description: Record your stress management progress and improvements

insights.title: Deep Insights
insights.description: Understand how stress affects your menstruation and overall health

techniques.title: Relaxation Techniques
techniques.subtitle: Scientific relaxation methods to help you relieve stress

breathing.title: Breathing Exercise
breathing.description: Relax body and mind through breathing regulation
breathing.instructionsDetail: Follow audio guidance for deep breathing exercises, practice for 5-10 minutes each time.

benefits.benefit2: Lower heart rate and blood pressure

meditation.title: Meditation Practice
meditation.instructionsDetail: Follow guided audio for meditation practice, start with 5 minutes and gradually extend.

exercise.title: Light Exercise
exercise.description: Gentle exercises suitable for menstrual periods
exercise.instructionsDetail: Choose gentle exercises suitable for menstrual periods, such as yoga, walking or stretching.

music.title: Music Therapy
music.instructionsDetail: Choose soothing music, close your eyes and listen for 10-15 minutes.

timing.title: Best Timing
timing.tip1: Practice after waking up or before bed
timing.tip3: Increase practice frequency one week before period

precautions.title: Precautions
precautions.tip1: Choose a quiet and comfortable environment
precautions.tip4: Stop immediately if you feel unwell

addEntry.title: Add Entry
addEntry.subtitle: Record your stress condition and techniques used today

insights.title: Deep Insights
insights.description: Understand your stress patterns and triggers

trends.title: Trend Analysis
trends.description: Discover areas for improvement and attention

quantifiedImpact.title: Quantified Impact Data
quantifiedImpact.subtitle: Stress impact data based on scientific research

details.title: Detailed Description
details.anxiety: Anxiety symptoms significantly worsen under high stress, affecting daily life and work performance.
details.depression: Depression is more likely to occur in high-stress environments and needs timely attention.
details.irritability: Irritability and mood swings are most obvious under high stress, affecting relationships.

insight1.title: Stress Accumulation Effect
insight1.description: Long-term stress has greater impact on menstruation than short-term stress

insight2.title: Individual Differences
insight2.description: Everyone has different sensitivity to stress

insight3.title: Reversibility
insight3.description: Most stress effects can recover after stress relief

insight4.title: Importance of Prevention
insight4.description: Early stress management is more effective than later treatment

immediate.title: Immediate Action
immediate.description: Identify stress sources and take relief measures

longterm.title: Long-term Strategy
longterm.description: Establish a continuous stress management system

painPatterns.title: Identify Your Pain Patterns
painPatterns.subtitle: Every woman's pain pattern is unique, but usually follows certain rules. Through detailed observation and recording, you can identify your own pain pattern and develop more effective prevention and management strategies.

menstrualFocused.title: Menstrual Concentrated Type (70%)
characteristics: Pain concentrated 1-2 days before and 1-2 days during menstruation
Pain significantly reduced or disappeared after the 3rd day
Pain intensity peaks on the 1st day

wholePeriodPersistent.title: Whole Period Persistent Type (20%)
characteristics: Lasts throughout the entire menstrual period

premenstrualProminent.title: Pre-menstrual Prominent Type (8%)
characteristics: Pain most severe 1-3 days before menstruation

irregularFluctuation.title: Irregular Fluctuation Type (2%)
characteristics: No clear pattern in pain timing
May be related to stress, lifestyle, and other factors

recordingImportance.title: Importance of Pain Records
recordingImportance.description: Keeping a detailed pain diary is the most effective way to understand personal patterns. By recording for 3-6 consecutive months, you will be able to clearly see your pain patterns.

analysisDimensions.title: Analysis Dimensions
items: Which day of the menstrual cycle is the pain most severe

influencingFactors.title: Factors Affecting Individual Cycle Patterns
influencingFactors.description: Every woman's menstrual cycle and pain pattern are influenced by multiple factors. Understanding these factors helps to better predict and manage pain.

ageAndDevelopment.title: Age and Developmental Stage
items: Adolescence (13-19 years old): Cycles are often irregular, pain may be more severe
Adulthood (20-35 years old): Cycles are generally stable, pain patterns are fixed
After childbirth: Approximately 60% of women experience reduced pain
Perimenopause: Cycles change significantly, pain patterns may change

bodyCharacteristics.title: Body Characteristics
items: Body fat percentage is related to estrogen metabolism
Individual differences in body sensitivity are large
Genetic factors account for a significant proportion

healthStatus.title: Health Status
items: Polycystic ovary syndrome leads to abnormal cycles
Pelvic inflammatory disease affects pain pattern

environmentalImpact.title: Environmental Impact
items: Light changes: Seasonal affective disorder affects hormones
Climate conditions: Atmospheric pressure changes may affect pain perception
Environmental toxins: Chemical substances interfere with hormone balance

socialPsychological.title: Social Psychological Factors
items: Cultural adaptation: Cognitive attitudes towards menstruation
Social support: Understanding level of family and friends
Work environment: Occupational stress and work arrangements

optimizationStrategies.title: Apply Knowledge to Optimize Pain Management
optimizationStrategies.description: After understanding the scientific knowledge of menstrual cycles and pain patterns, we can transform this information into practical strategies to optimize pain management effectiveness.

earlyLutealPhase.title: 1-2 weeks before menstruation (early luteal phase)
items: Start increasing anti-inflammatory food intake (omega-3, turmeric)
Optimize sleep quality, ensure 7-8 hours of rest
Engage in stress management activities (meditation, yoga)

premenstrualDays.title: 3-5 days before menstruation
items: Appropriately reduce caffeine and alcohol intake
Prepare heat therapy equipment and comfortable clothing

peakPainDays.title: Days 1-2 of menstruation (peak pain period)
items: Apply all available relief methods promptly
Maintain hydration, but avoid excessive fluids
Adopt optimal positioning for pain relief
Engage in gentle activities if possible, rest when needed

medicationTiming.title: Medication Timing
items: NSAIDs: Take 1-2 hours before pain starts for best effect
Hormone supplementation: Follow doctor's instructions for optimal absorption
Traditional Chinese medicine: Start conditioning herbs 1-2 weeks in advance

recoveryOptimization.title: Recovery Optimization
items: Progressive activity: Gradually increase activity level as pain subsides
Nutrition recovery: Focus on nutrient replenishment after menstruation
Reflection assessment: Evaluate the effectiveness of this treatment strategy

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
items: Menstrual cycle is a precisely regulated biological rhythm, understanding its mechanism helps in scientific pain management
Prostaglandins are the main cause of menstrual pain, but can be effectively managed through various methods
Everyone's pain pattern is unique, personal patterns can be discovered through detailed recording
Preventive intervention is superior to reactive treatment, timing is the key to success
Comprehensive consideration of physiological, psychological and environmental factors can achieve optimal treatment effects

medicalDisclaimer.title: Medical Disclaimer
medicalDisclaimer.content: The content on this website is for informational and educational purposes only and is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. We are not healthcare professionals. Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions you may have regarding a medical condition. In case of emergency, seek immediate medical attention. Use of this website does not establish a doctor-patient relationship.

cta.description: Use our intelligent pain tracking tool to start recording and analyzing your pain patterns

immediateReliefPage.title: Immediate Period Pain Relief
immediateReliefPage.description: Quick and effective methods to relieve menstrual pain right now. Science-backed techniques you can use immediately.
immediateReliefPage.introTitle: When You Need Relief Right Now
immediateReliefPage.introText: Menstrual pain can strike suddenly and severely. Whether you're at home, work, or on the go, these evidence-based methods can provide quick relief.
immediateReliefPage.introText2: Each method below includes scientific parameters and practical guidance to help you find what works best for your body.
immediateReliefPage.heatTherapyDescription: Heat therapy is one of the most effective immediate relief methods. It works by increasing blood flow, relaxing uterine muscles, and blocking pain signals.
immediateReliefPage.heatTherapyGuideDescription: Learn the science and best practices
immediateReliefPage.gentleMovementDescription: Gentle stretching and yoga poses can help relieve menstrual cramps by improving circulation, releasing muscle tension, and promoting relaxation.

poses.name: Child's Pose (Balasana)
poses.description: Kneel and fold forward, arms extended or by your sides
poses.benefits: Relieves back pain, calms the mind, gentle compression on abdomen

poses.name: Cat-Cow Pose (Marjaryasana-Bitilasana)
poses.description: On hands and knees, alternate between arching and rounding your spine
poses.benefits: Increases spinal flexibility, massages abdominal organs, improves circulation

poses.name: Supine Twist
poses.description: Lie on back, bring knees to chest, gently drop to one side
poses.benefits: Releases lower back tension, aids digestion, promotes relaxation

exercises.name: Deep Belly Breathing
exercises.steps: Place hand on belly, breathe deeply so belly expands, exhale slowly
exercises.benefits: Reduces stress hormones, promotes muscle relaxation

exercises.name: 4-7-8 Breathing
exercises.steps: Inhale through nose for 4 counts, hold for 7, exhale through mouth for 8
exercises.benefits: Calms nervous system, reduces pain perception, induces relaxation

timing.title: When to Practice:
timing.preventive: Preventive: Practice daily during the week before your period starts
timing.during: During pain: Use gentle movements only, listen to your body's signals
timing.continuous: Continuous: Regular practice improves long-term pain management

immediateReliefPage.breathingExerciseDescription: Controlled breathing activates your body's relaxation response, reducing stress hormones and pain perception. It's free, portable, and can be done anywhere, anytime.
immediateReliefPage.acupressureDescription: Acupressure uses finger pressure on specific points to relieve pain. It's based on traditional Chinese medicine and supported by modern research showing effectiveness for menstrual pain.

acupoints.name: Sanyinjiao (SP6)
acupoints.location: 3 finger-widths (about 4 fingers) above the inner ankle bone
acupoints.method: Press firmly with thumb in circular motion for 1-2 minutes
acupoints.benefits: Regulates menstruation, relieves cramps, reduces pain intensity

acupoints.name: Hegu (LI4)
acupoints.location: In the webbing between thumb and index finger
acupoints.method: Pinch and massage firmly for 1-2 minutes on each hand
acupoints.benefits: General pain relief, reduces tension, promotes energy flow

acupoints.name: Taichong (LV3)
acupoints.location: On top of foot, in the depression between big toe and second toe
acupoints.method: Press and hold firmly for 30-60 seconds, breathe deeply
acupoints.benefits: Relieves stress, regulates liver qi, reduces irritability

technique.title: Massage Technique Guide:
technique.pressure: Apply firm but comfortable pressure - you should feel sensation but not sharp pain
technique.time: Hold each point for 1-2 minutes, or until you feel relief
technique.frequency: Repeat 2-3 times daily during menstruation, or as needed
technique.precautions: ‚ö†Ô∏è Avoid SP6 during pregnancy. Stop if pain increases or you feel dizzy.

immediateReliefPage.otcOptionsDescription: NSAIDs (Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs) like ibuprofen are highly effective for menstrual pain. They work by blocking prostaglandin production, which causes cramps.
immediateReliefPage.meditationDescription: Reduce pain perception through mental techniques
immediateReliefPage.dietaryPlanDescription: Foods that help reduce menstrual pain
immediateReliefPage.workTipsDescription: Discreet relief methods for the workplace

immediateActions.action1: Apply heat or cold therapy immediately
immediateActions.action5: Contact your healthcare provider if pain persists

indicators.indicator1: Severe pain that doesn't respond to treatment

items.item1: Heat pack or hot water bottle

immediateReliefPage.findingWhatWorksText: Everyone's body responds differently to pain relief methods. Keep track of what works best for you.
immediateReliefPage.findingWhatWorksText2: Consider keeping a pain diary to identify patterns and effective strategies.
immediateReliefPage.disclaimerText: This information is for educational purposes only and does not replace professional medical advice. If you experience severe or unusual pain, please consult a healthcare provider.

heatTherapy.timing: Start at first sign of pain for best results
heatTherapy.mechanism: Increases blood flow, relaxes smooth muscle tissue, activates heat receptors to block pain signals

breathing.title: Breathing Exercise Parameters:
breathing.technique: 4-7-8 breathing (inhale 4 seconds, hold 7 seconds, exhale 8 seconds)
breathing.timing: Anytime, especially during pain spikes or stress
breathing.mechanism: Activates parasympathetic nervous system, reduces stress hormones (cortisol), promotes muscle relaxation

nsaid.title: NSAID Parameters:
nsaid.dosage: Follow package instructions (typically 200-400mg ibuprofen every 4-6 hours)
nsaid.timing: Take at first sign of pain, with food to protect stomach
nsaid.mechanism: Blocks prostaglandin production by inhibiting COX enzymes, reducing inflammation and pain
nsaid.contraindications: ‚ö†Ô∏è Avoid if you have stomach ulcers, kidney issues, bleeding disorders, or are allergic to NSAIDs. Consult doctor if taking blood thinners.

howTo.name: How to Relieve Period Pain Immediately
howTo.description: Step-by-step guide to immediate menstrual pain relief using evidence-based methods

heatTherapy.name: Apply Heat Therapy
heatTherapy.text: Apply a heating pad or hot water bottle to your lower abdomen at 40-45¬∞C for 15-20 minutes

breathing.name: Practice Breathing Exercises
breathing.text: Use 4-7-8 breathing technique: inhale for 4 seconds, hold for 7, exhale for 8. Repeat 5-10 times

acupressure.name: Try Acupressure Points
acupressure.text: Press Sanyinjiao (SP6) point, located 3 finger-widths above inner ankle, for 1-2 minutes

medication.name: Consider OTC Medication
medication.text: Take ibuprofen (200-400mg) at first sign of pain, with food

medicalCare.name: Seek Medical Care if Needed
medicalCare.text: Consult a healthcare provider if pain is severe, sudden, or accompanied by fever or unusual symptoms

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.description: Learn how Period Hub collects, uses, and protects your personal information and health data.

openGraph.description: Comprehensive privacy policy explaining how we handle your data with transparency and security.

privacyPolicy.intro: At Period Hub, we are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and safeguard your data.
privacyPolicy.importantNoticeText: Period Hub is currently in MVP (Minimum Viable Product) stage. We collect minimal data and do not share your information with third parties. All health data is stored locally on your device.

mvpNotice.title: MVP Stage Notice
mvpNotice.text: As an MVP product, we prioritize your privacy by minimizing data collection and keeping all sensitive health information on your device.

importantNote.title: Local Storage Priority
importantNote.text: Most of your health data (pain tracking, cycle information) is stored locally on your device and never sent to our servers.

userProvided.title: Information You Provide
userProvided.description: Data you voluntarily share when using our services

symptomData.title: Symptom & Health Data
symptomData.description: Pain levels, cycle tracking, and symptom information (stored locally)

technicalInfo.title: Technical Information
technicalInfo.description: Browser type, device information, and usage analytics

mainPurposes.title: Main Purposes
items: Analyze usage patterns to enhance features

neverUsedFor.title: We Never Use Your Data For

informationSharing.title: Information Sharing
informationSharing.content: We do not sell, trade, or rent your personal information to third parties. Your health data remains private and is only accessible to you.

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.disclaimer: While we implement industry-standard security measures, no method of transmission over the internet is 100% secure.

encryption.title: Encryption
encryption.description: All data transmission uses HTTPS encryption

accessControl.title: Access Control
accessControl.description: Strict access controls limit who can view your data

regularAudit.title: Regular Security Audits
regularAudit.description: We regularly review and update our security practices

management.title: Managing Cookies
management.text: You can control cookies through your browser settings. Note that disabling cookies may affect site functionality.

userRights.title: Your Rights
userRights.subtitle: You have control over your data

contactUs.title: Contact Us
contactUs.description: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or your data:

dataProtection.title: Data Protection Inquiries
dataProtection.subject: Subject: Privacy Policy Question
dataProtection.responseTime: We aim to respond within 48 hours

policyUpdates.title: Policy Updates
policyUpdates.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any significant changes via email or prominent notice on our website.
policyUpdates.recommendation: We recommend reviewing this policy periodically to stay informed about how we protect your information.

privacyPolicy.questionsDescription: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at privacy@periodhub.health

immediateReliefPage.introText2: Each method below includes scientific parameters and practical guidance to help you find what works best for your body.
immediateReliefPage.heatTherapyDescription: Heat therapy is one of the most effective immediate relief methods. It works by increasing blood flow, relaxing uterine muscles, and blocking pain signals.
immediateReliefPage.heatTherapyGuideDescription: Learn the science and best practices
immediateReliefPage.gentleMovementDescription: Gentle stretching and yoga poses can help relieve menstrual cramps by improving circulation, releasing muscle tension, and promoting relaxation.

poses.name: Child's Pose (Balasana)
poses.description: Kneel and fold forward, arms extended or by your sides
poses.benefits: Relieves back pain, calms the mind, gentle compression on abdomen

poses.name: Cat-Cow Pose (Marjaryasana-Bitilasana)
poses.description: On hands and knees, alternate between arching and rounding your spine
poses.benefits: Increases spinal flexibility, massages abdominal organs, improves circulation

poses.name: Supine Twist
poses.description: Lie on back, bring knees to chest, gently drop to one side
poses.benefits: Releases lower back tension, aids digestion, promotes relaxation

exercises.name: Deep Belly Breathing
exercises.steps: Place hand on belly, breathe deeply so belly expands, exhale slowly
exercises.benefits: Reduces stress hormones, promotes muscle relaxation

exercises.name: 4-7-8 Breathing
exercises.steps: Inhale through nose for 4 counts, hold for 7, exhale through mouth for 8
exercises.benefits: Calms nervous system, reduces pain perception, induces relaxation

timing.title: When to Practice:
timing.preventive: Preventive: Practice daily during the week before your period starts
timing.during: During pain: Use gentle movements only, listen to your body's signals
timing.continuous: Continuous: Regular practice improves long-term pain management

immediateReliefPage.breathingExerciseDescription: Controlled breathing activates your body's relaxation response, reducing stress hormones and pain perception. It's free, portable, and can be done anywhere, anytime.
immediateReliefPage.acupressureDescription: Acupressure uses finger pressure on specific points to relieve pain. It's based on traditional Chinese medicine and supported by modern research showing effectiveness for menstrual pain.

acupoints.name: Sanyinjiao (SP6)
acupoints.location: 3 finger-widths (about 4 fingers) above the inner ankle bone
acupoints.method: Press firmly with thumb in circular motion for 1-2 minutes
acupoints.benefits: Regulates menstruation, relieves cramps, reduces pain intensity

acupoints.name: Hegu (LI4)
acupoints.location: In the webbing between thumb and index finger
acupoints.method: Pinch and massage firmly for 1-2 minutes on each hand
acupoints.benefits: General pain relief, reduces tension, promotes energy flow

acupoints.name: Taichong (LV3)
acupoints.location: On top of foot, in the depression between big toe and second toe
acupoints.method: Press and hold firmly for 30-60 seconds, breathe deeply
acupoints.benefits: Relieves stress, regulates liver qi, reduces irritability

technique.title: Massage Technique Guide:
technique.pressure: Apply firm but comfortable pressure - you should feel sensation but not sharp pain
technique.time: Hold each point for 1-2 minutes, or until you feel relief
technique.frequency: Repeat 2-3 times daily during menstruation, or as needed
technique.precautions: ‚ö†Ô∏è Avoid SP6 during pregnancy. Stop if pain increases or you feel dizzy.

immediateReliefPage.otcOptionsDescription: NSAIDs (Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs) like ibuprofen are highly effective for menstrual pain. They work by blocking prostaglandin production, which causes cramps.

methods.method1: Apply heat therapy while practicing deep breathing exercises
methods.method2: Enhanced muscle relaxation and stress reduction
Dual approach to pain relief and mental calm

methods.method1: Gentle yoga followed by heat therapy

immediateReliefPage.meditationDescription: Reduce pain perception through mental techniques
immediateReliefPage.dietaryPlanDescription: Foods that help reduce menstrual pain
immediateReliefPage.workTipsDescription: Discreet relief methods for the workplace

immediateActions.action1: Apply heat or cold therapy immediately
immediateActions.action5: Contact your healthcare provider if pain persists

indicators.indicator1: Severe pain that doesn't respond to treatment

items.item1: Heat pack or hot water bottle

immediateReliefPage.findingWhatWorksText: Everyone's body responds differently to pain relief methods. Keep track of what works best for you.
immediateReliefPage.findingWhatWorksText2: Consider keeping a pain diary to identify patterns and effective strategies.
immediateReliefPage.disclaimerText: This information is for educational purposes only and does not replace professional medical advice. If you experience severe or unusual pain, please consult a healthcare provider.

heatTherapy.timing: Start at first sign of pain for best results
heatTherapy.mechanism: Increases blood flow, relaxes smooth muscle tissue, activates heat receptors to block pain signals

breathing.title: Breathing Exercise Parameters:
breathing.technique: 4-7-8 breathing (inhale 4 seconds, hold 7 seconds, exhale 8 seconds)
breathing.timing: Anytime, especially during pain spikes or stress
breathing.mechanism: Activates parasympathetic nervous system, reduces stress hormones (cortisol), promotes muscle relaxation

nsaid.title: NSAID Parameters:
nsaid.dosage: Follow package instructions (typically 200-400mg ibuprofen every 4-6 hours)
nsaid.timing: Take at first sign of pain, with food to protect stomach
nsaid.mechanism: Blocks prostaglandin production by inhibiting COX enzymes, reducing inflammation and pain
nsaid.contraindications: ‚ö†Ô∏è Avoid if you have stomach ulcers, kidney issues, bleeding disorders, or are allergic to NSAIDs. Consult doctor if taking blood thinners.

howTo.name: How to Relieve Period Pain Immediately
howTo.description: Step-by-step guide to immediate menstrual pain relief using evidence-based methods

heatTherapy.name: Apply Heat Therapy
heatTherapy.text: Apply a heating pad or hot water bottle to your lower abdomen at 40-45¬∞C for 15-20 minutes

breathing.name: Practice Breathing Exercises
breathing.text: Use 4-7-8 breathing technique: inhale for 4 seconds, hold for 7, exhale for 8. Repeat 5-10 times

acupressure.name: Try Acupressure Points
acupressure.text: Press Sanyinjiao (SP6) point, located 3 finger-widths above inner ankle, for 1-2 minutes

medication.name: Consider OTC Medication
medication.text: Take ibuprofen (200-400mg) at first sign of pain, with food

medicalCare.name: Seek Medical Care if Needed
medicalCare.text: Consult a healthcare provider if pain is severe, sudden, or accompanied by fever or unusual symptoms

breathingExercise.title: 4-7-8 Breathing Exercise
breathingExercise.description: Based on scientifically validated 4-7-8 breathing method, quickly relieves pain by regulating the nervous system. No download required, start practicing immediately.

precautions.title: Precautions:
items: Find a comfortable sitting or lying position

breathingExercise.subtitle: Achieve natural pain relief through nervous system regulation
breathingExercise.tip: üí° Tip: Find a comfortable sitting or lying position, relax all muscles. Beginners can do 3-4 cycles.
